info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 10:00AM EDT until March 25 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding is ongoing around Lake Rhodhiss due to high pools. * WHERE...Extreme northeast Burke and extreme southeast Caldwell counties in North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of the lake shoreline along Lake Rhodhiss is ongoing. Nuisance flooding is defined as less than 2` inundation of docks, low-lying residential yards, and boat-access areas surrounding the lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 948 AM EDT, High flows along tributaries feeding Lake Rhodhiss are causing a rapid pool rise following widespread heavy rainfall of 2-4 inches on Wednesday. The pool at Lake Rhodhiss is at 101.8 feet and is expected to rise near 102.0 feet over the next couple of hours before cresting and beginning a gradual recession. A reasonable worst-case crest of 102.5 feet is possible. Full pool is 100.0 feet. The lake should fall back below full pool later tonight. This will cause nuisance flooding along the lake shoreline including of docks, boat-access areas, and some residential yards. The Flood Advisory will remain in effect until the pool drops back below 101.0 feet. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rhodhiss, Lake Rhodhiss.
